appId.description: The unique application identifier located within a specific application directory instance.

contactEmail.description: E-mail to receive queries about the application

customConfig.description: An optional set of name value pairs that can be used to deliver custom data from an App Directory to a platform.

description.description: Description of the application. This will typically be a 1-2 paragraph style blurb about the application. This should be plain text.

icons.description: Holds Icons used for the application. The icon can be used in the OpenFin Workspace HOME, STORE and DOCK components.

images.description: Array of images to show the user when they are looking at app description.

intents.description: The list of intents implemented by the Application

manifest.description: URI or full JSON of the application manifest providing all details related to launch and use requirements as described by OpenFin. The format of this manifest for this platform is OpenFin specific, but can be identified by the manifestType attribute.

manifestType.description: The manifest type which relates to the format and structure of the manifest content. The definition is based on what is supported by the platform this application directory is running against.

name.description: The name of the application. The name should be unique within an App Directory instance.

publisher.description: The name of the company that owns the application. The publisher has control over their namespace/app/signature.

supportEmail.description: E-mail to receive queries about the application

title.description: Title for the application, Can be used in the OpenFin Workspace HOME, STORE and DOCK components.

tooltip.description: Optional tooltip description e.g. for a OpenFin Workspace Dock button

version.description: Version of the application. This allows multiple app versions to be defined using the same app name. This can be a triplet but can also include things like 1.2.5 (BETA)

contexts.description: A comma separated list of the types of contexts the intent offered by the application can process. where the first part of the context type is the namespace e.g."fdc3.contact, org.companyname.contact"

customConfig.description: Custom configuration for the intent that may be required by a platform.

displayName.description: An optional display name for the intent that may be used in UI instead of the name.

name.description: The name of the intent to 'launch'. In this case the name of an Intent supported by an Application.

instanceMode.description: This only applies to web views/windows. Default is multi instance. Should we aim to only launch one instance of this application and only show the app even if the intent resolver ui supports instances of apps.

private.description: Should this application not be listed in OpenFin Workspace components e.g. Workspace HOME, DOCK or STORE. It may be that this app entry is mainly for responding to intent requests and shouldn't be launched directly.

FDC3VOnePointTwoAppDirectoryResponse.description: The successful response expected from a FDC3 1.2 request when all applications are requested.

$schema.description: The schema that helps guide the structure of the response

message.description: Response message providing status of query

metadata.description: Metadata that provides information beyond the url path to help identify the format of the response that has been received.
